meanings.definition: Pronunciation in which the lips are rounded.
meanings.sent1: Her labialized speech made it easier for her to pronounce certain sounds.
meanings.sent2: The teacher explained the concept of labialized sounds in phonetics class.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's exaggerated labialized pronunciation of words always made the audience laugh.
meanings.sent4: The labialized vowels in the language added a soft and melodic touch to the words.
meanings.sent5: The singer's labialized singing style gave a unique charm to the performance.

meanings.sent1: She labialized the word 'moon' by rounding her lips while speaking.
meanings.sent2: He labialized the difficult sounds in the language to improve his accent.
meanings.sent3: The toddler tried to labialized all his words, making his speech sound adorable.
meanings.sent4: The actor labialized his lines with precision, capturing the essence of the character.
meanings.sent5: Labialized consonants can be challenging to master but add richness to speech.
